member.name: M:Alteruna.API.GameClientApi.Client.GetSingleRoomServers(Alteruna.API.GameClientApi.GetSingleRoomServersInput,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Get Single Room Game Servers
member.remarks:
List game servers for a project in Single Room mode. Does different
things depending on the `displayName` property of the request body:
- If `displayName` is omitted, all non-private servers are returned.
- If `displayName` is included, all servers with an exactly
(case-sensitive) matching display name are returned, regardless of them
being private or non-private.
This operation only works if the project is in Single Room mode.
member.exception: A server side error occurred.

member.name: M:Alteruna.API.GameClientApi.Client.RegisterUnmanagedSingleRoomServer(Alteruna.API.GameClientApi.RegisterUnmanagedSingleRoomServerInput,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Register Unmanaged Single Room Server
member.remarks: Register a new unmanaged single room server. Only works if the project is in Single Room mode. Returns a **secret** key (`unmanagedSingleRoomServerKey`) which can later be used to update and deregister the server.
member.exception: A server side error occurred.

member.name: M:Alteruna.API.GameClientApi.Client.UpdateUnmanagedSingleRoomServer(System.String,Alteruna.API.GameClientApi.UpdateUnmanagedSingleRoomServerInput,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Update Unmanaged Single Room Server
member.remarks: Updates an unmanaged single room server. This operation is also used as a keep-alive mechanism for running unmanaged single room servers. The unmanaged single room server is identified using the **secret** key obtained from the `registerUnmanagedSingleRoomServer` operation. Only works if the project is in Single Room mode.
member.exception: A server side error occurred.

member.name: M:Alteruna.API.GameClientApi.Client.DeregisterUnmanagedSingleRoomServer(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.summary: Deregister Unmanaged Single Room Server
member.remarks: Deregisters an unmanaged single room server. Unmanaged single room servers that fail their keep-alive check are deregistered automatically. Only works if the project is in Single Room mode.
member.exception: A server side error occurred.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket
member.summary: Represents RFC4330 SNTP packet used for communication to and from a network time server.

remarks.para: Most applications should just use the property.
The same data structure represents both request and reply packets. Request and reply differ in which properties are set and to what values.

The only real property is . All other properties read from and write to the underlying byte array with the exception of , which is not part of the packet on network and it is instead set locally after receiving the packet.
Copied from GuerrillaNtp project with permission from Robert Vazan (@robertvazan) under MIT license, see https://github.com/RevenantX/LiteNetLib/pull/236

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.Bytes
member.summary: Gets RFC4330-encoded SNTP packet.
member.value: Byte array containing RFC4330-encoded SNTP packet. It is at least 48 bytes long.
member.remarks: This is the only real property. All other properties except read from or write to this byte array.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.LeapIndicator
member.summary: Gets the leap second indicator.
member.value: Leap second warning, if any. Special value indicates unsynchronized server clock. Default is .
member.remarks: Only servers fill in this property. Clients can consult this property for possible leap second warning.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.VersionNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets protocol version number.
member.value: SNTP protocol version. Default is 4, which is the latest version at the time of this writing.
member.remarks: In request packets, clients should leave this property at default value 4. Servers usually reply with the same protocol version.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets SNTP packet mode, i.e. whether this is client or server packet.
member.value: SNTP packet mode. Default is in newly created packets. Server reply should have this property set to .

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.Stratum
member.summary: Gets server's distance from the reference clock.

value.para: Distance from the reference clock. This property is set only in server reply packets. Servers connected directly to reference clock hardware set this property to 1. Statum number is incremented by 1 on every hop down the NTP server hierarchy.
Special value 0 indicates that this packet is a Kiss-o'-Death message with kiss code stored in .

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.Poll
member.summary: Gets server's preferred polling interval.
member.value: Polling interval in log2 seconds, e.g. 4 stands for 16s and 17 means 131,072s.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.Precision
member.summary: Gets the precision of server clock.
member.value: Clock precision in log2 seconds, e.g. -20 for microsecond precision.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.RootDelay
member.summary: Gets the total round-trip delay from the server to the reference clock.
member.value: Round-trip delay to the reference clock. Normally a positive value smaller than one second.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.RootDispersion
member.summary: Gets the estimated error in time reported by the server.
member.value: Estimated error in time reported by the server. Normally a positive value smaller than one second.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.ReferenceId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the time source used by the server or Kiss-o'-Death code sent by the server.

value.para: ID of server's time source or Kiss-o'-Death code. Purpose of this property depends on value of property.
Stratum 1 servers write here one of several special values that describe the kind of hardware clock they use.
Stratum 2 and lower servers set this property to IPv4 address of their upstream server. If upstream server has IPv6 address, the address is hashed, because it doesn't fit in this property.
When server sets to special value 0, this property contains so called kiss code that instructs the client to stop querying the server.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.ReferenceTimestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the time when the server clock was last set or corrected.
member.value: Time when the server clock was last set or corrected or null when not specified.
member.remarks: This Property is usually set only by servers. It usually lags server's current time by several minutes, so don't use this property for time synchronization.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.OriginTimestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the time when the client sent its request.
member.value: This property is null in request packets. In reply packets, it is the time when the client sent its request. Servers copy this value from that they find in received request packet.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.ReceiveTimestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the time when the request was received by the server.
member.value: This property is null in request packets. In reply packets, it is the time when the server received client request.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.TransmitTimestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the time when the packet was sent.
member.value: Time when the packet was sent. It should never be null. Default value is .
member.remarks: This property must be set by both clients and servers.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.DestinationTimestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the time of reception of response SNTP packet on the client.
member.value: Time of reception of response SNTP packet on the client. It is null in request packets.
member.remarks: This property is not part of the protocol and has to be set when reply packet is received.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.RoundTripTime
member.summary: Gets the round-trip time to the server.
member.value: Time the request spent traveling to the server plus the time the reply spent traveling back. This is calculated from timestamps in the packet as (t1 - t0) + (t3 - t2) where t0 is , t1 is , t2 is , and t3 is . This property throws an exception in request packets.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core._3rdparty.LiteNetLib_0._9._5._2.Utils.NtpPacket.CorrectionOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset that should be added to local time to synchronize it with server time.
member.value: Time difference between server and client. It should be added to local time to get server time. It is calculated from timestamps in the packet as 0.5 * ((t1 - t0) - (t3 - t2)) where t0 is , t1 is , t2 is , and t3 is . This property throws an exception in request packets.

member.summary: Initializes default request packet.
member.remarks: Properties and are set appropriately for request packet. Property is set to .

member.summary: Resizes the given list to the specified new size and trims any excess capacity. If the new size is greater than the current size, the list's capacity will be adjusted accordingly. If the new size is smaller, extra elements are removed from the list, and the excess capacity is trimmed.
member.typeparam: The type of elements in the list.
member.param: The list to resize and trim.
The desired size of the list after resizing.
member.returns: The number of elements added to or removed from the list as a result of resizing.

member.name: M:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.ListUtility.TrySetCapacity``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to set the capacity of the specified list to the given value.
member.remarks: If the new capacity is greater than the current capacity, the list's capacity is updated. If the current capacity is already equal to or greater than the specified value, no changes are made.
member.typeparam: The type of elements in the list.
member.param: The list whose capacity is to be modified.
The desired capacity for the list.
member.returns: True if the capacity was changed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.PacketProcessing.Compression.NibbleZeroIndicator
member.summary:
In-house compression method written by Simon Jonasson. This method is efficient at storing numeric values, but not so efficient at storing ASCII or UTF8 strings.
We take advantage of the fact that numeric values commonly contains at least one nibble that is zero. (nibble = 4 bits = half a byte) A random byte has a 25% chance of having at least one zero nibble. By using a flag byte where each bit represents a nibble, we can store if the nibble is zero or not; then only write the non-zero nibbles.
So for example, if we want to store the data { 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 }, the compressed data would be { 0x00 }. And if we want to store the data { 0x00 0x00 0x0A 0x01 }, the compressed data would be { 0x05 0xA1 }.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionJoinedPacket
member.summary: Class SessionJoinedPacket defines the protocol primitive sent to all joined devices in a session when a new device has joined the session.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionObservedPacket
member.summary: Class SessionObservedPacket defines the protocol primitive sent to all joined devices in a session when a new device has started to observe the session.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionJoinPacket
member.summary: Class SessionJoinPacket defines the protocol primitive sent to a playroom host when a device wish to join a hosted session.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionJoinReplyPacket
member.summary: Class SessionJoinReplyPacket defines the protocol primitive sent as a response to received SessionJoinPacket indicating if the join request was accepted or why it was rejected.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionObservePacket
member.summary: Class SessionObservePacket defines the protocol primitive sent to a playroom host when a device wish to observe a hosted session. An observe request, as a difference from a join request, indicates that the observer do not commit its application state. An observer solely receives synchronization primities and updates its application state accordingly.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionObserveReplyPacket
member.summary: Class SessionObserveReplyPacket defines the protocol primitive sent as a response to received SessionObservePacket indicating if the join request was accepted or why it was rejected.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionCreatePacket
member.summary: Class SessionCreatePacket defines the protocol primitive sent to a playroom host to request a new session/playroom to be created.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionCreateReplyPacket
member.summary: Class SessionCreateReplyPacket defines the protocol primitive sent as a response to SessionCreatePacket.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionGetReplyPacket
member.summary: Class SessionGetReplyPacket defines the protocol primitive sent as a response to SessionGetPacket. Includes information about the available sessions in the host.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionTransferPacket
member.summary: Class SessionTransferPacket defines the protocol primitive sent in order to request that hosted session to be transfered to the receving host.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionTransferReplyPacket
member.summary: Class SessionTransferReplyPacket defines the protocol primitive sent as a response to a received SessionTransferPacket. Upon success, the receiving host has taken over the session and reports the session ID of the transfered session on the new host.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionMigratePacket
member.summary: Class SessionMigratePacket defines the protocol primitive sent as a final step in a session tranfer process. When a session has been transfered to a new host. The device that initiated the session tranfer process must send a SessionMigratePacket to all other (except the new transfered host) devices in the session in order for them to connect and migrate to the new host.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionDisconnectUserPacket
member.summary: Class SessionDisconnectUserPacket defines the protocol primitive sent in order to remotely remove a user from remove session

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionDisconnectUserReplyPacket
member.summary: Class SessionDisconnectUserReplyPacket defines the protocol primitive sent as a reply to a user disconnect request

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionRemovePacket
member.summary: Class SessionRemovePacket defines the protocol primitive sent in order to remotely remove a session from a server

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionRemoveReplyPacket
member.summary: Class SessionRemoveReplyPacket defines the protocol primitive sent as a reply to a remove request

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.QueryDeviceStatPacket
member.summary: Class QueryDeviceStatPacket defines the protocol primitive sent in order to request device statistics

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.QueryDeviceStatReplyPacket
member.summary: Class QueryDeviceStatReplyPacket defines the protocol primitive sent as a reply to a received QueryDeviceStatPacket. Carries device statistics.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.ICodecRequest
member.summary: Interface ICodecRequest defines a interface to receiving a ISerializable for a given globally unique identifier.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionForceSyncPacket
member.summary: Class SessionForceSyncPacket defines the protocol primitive sent from a host to selected device in order to force the device to synchronize all its available states. Normally sent to an already joined device in a session when a new device has joined. Primarily in order to ensure that the new device is updated with the current state.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SynchronizableElement
member.summary: Struct SynchronizableElement models an element represented by a globally unique identifier and an implementation of an ISerializable

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionForceSyncReplyPacket
member.summary: Class SessionForceSyncReplyPacket defines the protocol primitive sent from a host to selected device in order to force the device

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.Core.Packets.SessionSyncPacket
member.summary: Class SessionSyncPacket defines the protocol primitive sent from a client to the device hosting the session. Carries a collection of synchronizables that it intend to update.

member.name: T:Alteruna.Multiplayer.RigidbodySynchronizable
member.summary: Control and synchronizes an object's position through physics simulation.

member.name: F:Alteruna.Multiplayer.RigidbodySynchronizable.Rigidbody
member.summary: Rigidbody to synchronize.

summary.para: The velocity vector of the rigidbody. It represents the rate of change of Rigidbody position.
The angular velocity vector of the rigidbody measured in radians per second.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.RigidbodySynchronizable.position

summary.para: The position of the rigidbody.

member.example:
Rigidbody.position allows you to get and set the position of a Rigidbody using the physics engine. If you change the position of a Rigibody using Rigidbody.position, the transform will be updated after the next physics simulation step. This is faster than updating the position using Transform.position, as the latter will cause all attached Colliders to recalculate their positions relative to the Rigidbody.
If you want to continuously move a rigidbody use MovePosition instead, which takes interpolation into account.

member.name: P:Alteruna.Multiplayer.RigidbodySynchronizable.rotation

summary.para: The rotation of the Rigidbody.

member.example:
Use Rigidbody.rotation to get and set the rotation of a Rigidbody using the physics engine.
Changing the rotation of a Rigidbody using Rigidbody.rotation updates the Transform after the next physics simulation step. This is faster than updating the rotation using Transform.rotation, as Transform.rotation causes all attached Colliders to recalculate their rotation relative to the Rigidbody, whereas Rigidbody.rotation sets the values directly to the physics system.
If you want to continuously rotate a rigidbody use MoveRotation instead, which takes interpolation into account.
